intro: Canthium corymbosum, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and the plant often grows in moist, open habitats. Canthium corymbosum is typically found in wetlands, swamps, and along stream banks.
